perturbation.original_text: NETGEAR warrants to end-user that each item of Hardware will be free from defects in workmanship and materials for its respective warranty period which begins on the date of purchase by the end user. Should a Product fail within this warranty period, Distributor shall replace such defective Product from Distributor's inventory and accept return of the failed Product from Distributor's customer. At intervals to be mutually agreed upon between NETGEAR and Distributor. Distributor shall contact NETGEAR to receive a Return Material Authorization number for the collected failed Product. Upon receipt of the failed Product, NETGEAR shall issue a credit to Distributor for Distributor's purchase price of the replacement Product issued, less any prior credits or allowances. End-users' exclusive remedy is to receive replacement Product from reseller and NETGEAR's sole obligation and liability under this warranty is to issue an off-setting credit to reseller for Product returned by reseller on behalf of its end-user because of defects in workmanship or material.
perturbation.changed_text: NETGEAR warrants to end-user that each item of Hardware will be free from defects in workmanship and materials for a period of time decided by NETGEAR after the purchase by the end user. Should a Product fail within this period, NETGEAR may decide to replace the defective Product at its discretion and accept the return of the failed Product from Distributor's customer. At intervals decided by NETGEAR, Distributor shall contact NETGEAR for instructions. Upon receipt of the failed Product, NETGEAR shall decide to issue a credit to Distributor for Distributor's purchase price of the replacement Product issued, less any prior credits or allowances. End-users' exclusive remedy is to request a replacement Product from reseller and NETGEAR's sole obligation and liability under this warranty is to consider issuing an off-setting credit to reseller for Product returned by reseller on behalf of its end-user because of defects in workmanship or material.
perturbation.explanation: The original warranty terms clearly define the start of the warranty period and the distributor's responsibility for replacing defective products. The modified version makes the warranty period discretionary and changes 'shall replace' to 'may decide to replace', thus creating uncertainty and contradicting the original obligation. It adds discretion for NETGEAR in deciding credit issuance, conflicting with standard warranty enforcement.
perturbation.contradicted_law: Breach of Contract, potential violation of consumer protection laws regarding warranty obligations

perturbation.original_text: The relationship of NETGEAR and Distributor is that of independent contractors. There is no relationship of agency, partnership, joint venture, employment or franchise between the parties. Neither party has the authority to bind the other or to incur any obligation on the other's behalf or to represent itself as the other's agent or in any way which might result in confusion as to the fact that the parties are separate and distinct entities.
perturbation.changed_text: The relationship of NETGEAR and Distributor is that of independent contractors. There is no relationship of agency, partnership, joint venture, employment or franchise between the parties, except that the Distributor acts as NETGEAR's representative in customer support and warranty claims. Neither party has the authority to bind the other or to incur any obligation on the other's behalf or to represent itself as the other's agent or in any way which might result in confusion as to the fact that the parties are separate and distinct entities, unless explicitly authorized by NETGEAR.
perturbation.explanation: The original clause explicitly states 'no relationship of agency.' The modified version contradicts this by stating the Distributor acts as NETGEAR's 'representative' in support and warranty claims, which implies an agency relationship. This creates a legal contradiction and ambiguity regarding liability and authority.
perturbation.contradicted_law: Agency Law, specifically regarding apparent authority and fiduciary duty

perturbation.original_text:
All notices given under the Agreement are to be in writing and may be sent by mail, telefax, courier service or otherwise delivered to the party to be notified at the following address, or to such other address as may have been substituted by written notice:

         To Distributor:                      To NETGEAR:          1600 E. ST. ANDREWS PL.              4401 Great America Parkway          P.O. BOX 25125                       P.O. Box 58185          SANTA ANA, CA 92799-5125             Santa Clara, CA 95052-8185          (???)                                Patricia Dutra-Gerard
perturbation.changed_text:
All notices given under the Agreement are to be given electronically, but may also be sent by mail or courier service to the party to be notified. The address for electronic notices is to be specified by each party on request. For other notices, addresses are:

         To Distributor:                      To NETGEAR:          1600 E. ST. ANDREWS PL.              4401 Great America Parkway          P.O. BOX 25125                       P.O. Box 58185          SANTA ANA, CA 92799-5125             Santa Clara, CA 95052-8185          (???)                                Patricia Dutra-Gerard

Failure to provide an electronic notification as specified above will not invalidate any notice provided under this agreement.
perturbation.explanation: While the original clause dictates that all notice 'may be sent' by mail, telefax, or courier service. The modification changes it to 'to be given electronically', but follows it up with a caveat in the last sentence that specifies any notice not sent this way, will not invalidate notices in general. The modified version introduces uncertainty to the agreement. It doesn't specify what service is to be used. If one of the companies is in default of the contract, is it legally binding if the distributor notifies NETGEAR through courier, instead of an ambiguous electronic notification?
perturbation.contradicted_law: Contract Law: Rules of Notification, specifically enforceability of notice clauses
